attributes.comment:
Due to Govt. logistics in the apodtion process with China it often takes updwards
of 2-3 years before a child can be successfully adopted. For those who have taken
this monumental leap into adopting within China the every changing environmet of
legal and policy delays is hard enough. The re-assesed fee's charged for a second
time due to such delays is simply wrong. Reconsider the 18 months period for
those who are right in the middle of the process and are still fighting for their child.
Charging fee's again for the i1600A and fingerprints is excessive and is essentially
double dipping.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Dale Burton
